leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 医学影像-分割/检测/诊断生态
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 预处理→训练/推理→评测→部署
leaf_cluster.tool_form: 框架 + 标注/数据 + 部署

queries: [WEB] dicom anonymization tools open source github
[WEB] medical image ai deployment framework github
[WEB] medical imaging privacy preserving tools github
[WEB] pacs integration for ai models github

tools.name: xnatutils
tools.one_line_profile: CLI scripts for managing data on XNAT imaging repositories
tools.detailed_description: A collection of command-line interface scripts designed to facilitate the uploading, downloading, and listing of medical imaging data on XNAT repositories, streamlining data management workflows.

tools.name: HD-GLIO-XNAT
tools.one_line_profile: Automated brain tumor segmentation tool for XNAT
tools.detailed_description: A containerized processing tool integrated into XNAT for automated segmentation and volumetric assessment of brain tumors (glioblastoma) in MRI scans, designed for clinical and research workflows.

tools.name: OHIF-AI
tools.one_line_profile: OHIF Viewer with server-side AI segmentation integration
tools.detailed_description: An extension of the OHIF DICOM Web viewer that integrates server-side AI models (such as SAM2, nninteractive, medSAM2) to enable advanced, interactive segmentation and annotation of medical images directly within the viewer.

tools.name: orthanc-cli
tools.one_line_profile: Command-line interface for Orthanc DICOM server
tools.detailed_description: A CLI tool for interacting with and managing Orthanc DICOM servers, facilitating administrative tasks and data operations in medical imaging infrastructure.

tools.name: DICOMcloud
tools.one_line_profile: Azure-friendly DICOMweb server implementation
tools.detailed_description: A .NET-based DICOMweb server implementation supporting QIDO-RS, WADO-RS, and STOW-RS standards, designed for storing and serving medical imaging data, particularly on Azure cloud infrastructure.

tools.name: orthanc-mongodb
tools.one_line_profile: MongoDB storage plugin for Orthanc
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for the Orthanc DICOM server that enables the use of MongoDB as the backend database, enhancing scalability and data management capabilities for medical imaging archives.

tools.name: healthcare-api-dicomweb-cli
tools.one_line_profile: CLI for Google Cloud Healthcare API DICOMweb
tools.detailed_description: A command-line tool developed by Google Cloud Platform for interacting with DICOMweb servers, facilitating the ingestion, retrieval, and management of medical imaging data in the cloud.

tools.name: img2catalog
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to expose XNAT data as FAIR Data Points
tools.detailed_description: A utility designed to transform and expose metadata from XNAT imaging repositories as FAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Reusable) Data Points, facilitating data discovery and sharing in research.

tools.name: xnnppx
tools.one_line_profile: Integration of XNAT with NiPype via pyxnat
tools.detailed_description: A tool bridging XNAT and NiPype using pyxnat, enabling the construction and execution of neuroimaging processing pipelines that interact directly with XNAT data repositories.

tools.name: orthanc-ai-orchestrator
tools.one_line_profile: Orthanc plugin for AI workflow orchestration
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for the Orthanc DICOM server that simulates an AI workflow orchestrator, managing job tickets and coordinating the execution of AI pipelines on medical imaging data.

tools.name: ohif-viewer-XNAT-plugin
tools.one_line_profile: XNAT plugin to integrate OHIF Viewer
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for XNAT that embeds the OHIF Viewer, providing a zero-footprint, web-based DICOM visualization capability directly within the XNAT research platform interface.

tools.name: Medical-Data-Anonymization-DICOM-DCMTK
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM and video anonymization tool
tools.detailed_description: A C++ based tool utilizing DCMTK, OpenCV, and FFmpeg to perform anonymization on medical data, including both DICOM images and video files, ensuring patient privacy compliance.

tools.name: Kira_DICOM-RT-Anonymizer-MG
tools.one_line_profile: Anonymizer for DICOM-RT files
tools.detailed_description: A specialized tool for anonymizing DICOM Radiotherapy (DICOM-RT) files, preserving critical RT structure connections and UIDs while removing patient identifying information.

tools.name: dicom-anonymizer
tools.one_line_profile: Standard-compliant DICOM anonymization tool
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool developed by Kitware for anonymizing DICOM files in accordance with the DICOM standard, supporting customizable anonymization rules and batch processing.

tools.name: XNATSlicer
tools.one_line_profile: Integration module for XNAT and 3D Slicer
tools.detailed_description: A module that integrates the XNAT imaging informatics platform with 3D Slicer, enabling users to load data from XNAT into Slicer for visualization and analysis, and save results back to XNAT.

tools.name: clara-dicom-adapter
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM integration adapter for NVIDIA Clara
tools.detailed_description: A component of the NVIDIA Clara Deploy SDK that handles DICOM data ingestion, routing, and job triggering, facilitating the integration of AI models into clinical imaging workflows.

tools.name: jupyter4xnat
tools.one_line_profile: Jupyter Notebook service integration for XNAT
tools.detailed_description: A plugin that adds Jupyter Notebook capabilities directly to the XNAT platform, allowing researchers to perform interactive data analysis and processing on stored imaging data within the XNAT environment.

tools.name: container-service
tools.one_line_profile: Container execution service for XNAT
tools.detailed_description: The core XNAT plugin that enables the orchestration and execution of Docker containers for image processing and analysis pipelines directly within the XNAT platform.

tools.name: karnak
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM gateway for de-identification and routing
tools.detailed_description: A DICOM gateway designed to act as an intermediary for publishing images to systems like Kheops, providing robust de-identification and data routing capabilities for research workflows.

tools.name: MONAI Generative Models
tools.one_line_profile: Generative AI models for medical imaging
tools.detailed_description: A library within the MONAI ecosystem focused on training, evaluating, and deploying generative models (e.g., GANs, Diffusion Models) specifically for medical imaging tasks such as synthesis and augmentation.

tools.name: MONAI
tools.one_line_profile: AI Toolkit for Healthcare Imaging
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive, open-source framework based on PyTorch for deep learning in healthcare imaging, providing domain-optimized capabilities for training, processing, and deploying medical AI models.

tools.name: MONAILabel
tools.one_line_profile: Intelligent image labeling and learning tool
tools.detailed_description: A server-client system that facilitates AI-assisted annotation of medical imaging data, integrating with viewers like 3D Slicer and OHIF to accelerate the creation of labeled datasets.

tools.name: MONAI Deploy
tools.one_line_profile: Standard framework for developing, packaging, and deploying medical AI applications
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive framework designed to become the standard for the clinical production lifecycle of medical AI applications. It handles packaging (MONAI Application Packages), testing, and deployment, bridging the gap between research and clinical environments.

tools.name: MONAI Deploy App SDK
tools.one_line_profile: SDK for building and verifying AI-driven healthcare imaging applications
tools.detailed_description: A software development kit that provides the necessary tools and interfaces to design, develop, and verify MONAI Application Packages (MAPs). It abstracts the complexity of medical data I/O and allows researchers to focus on the AI inference logic.

tools.name: MONAI Deploy App Server
tools.one_line_profile: Inference server for running MONAI Application Packages (MAPs)
tools.detailed_description: The runtime environment responsible for executing medical AI applications packaged as MAPs. It manages the lifecycle of inference tasks and connects the AI models with the underlying infrastructure.

tools.name: MONAI Deploy Informatics Gateway
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM integration service for medical imaging data ingestion and export
tools.detailed_description: A service that facilitates integration with clinical systems (PACS/RIS) via DICOM protocols. It handles data ingestion, triggers analysis workflows, and pushes results back to hospital systems, acting as the bridge between clinical data and AI processing.

tools.name: MONAI Deploy Workflow Manager
tools.one_line_profile: Orchestration engine for medical AI clinical workflows
tools.detailed_description: A subsystem of MONAI Deploy that manages and orchestrates the execution of clinical AI workflows. It coordinates data flow and task execution between the Informatics Gateway and the App Server.

tools.name: RSNA DICOM Anonymizer
tools.one_line_profile: Standard tool for de-identifying DICOM medical imaging data
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based tool developed by the Radiological Society of North America (RSNA) for anonymizing DICOM files. It ensures patient privacy compliance by removing or masking sensitive metadata in medical images.

tools.name: datman
tools.one_line_profile: Neuroimaging data management and quality control pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A suite of scripts and tools for managing neuroimaging data lifecycles, including interaction with XNAT, quality control (QC), and data organization. Developed by the TIGRLab (The Imaging Genetics and Neuroinformatics Lab).

tools.name: medical_image_deidentification
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive tool for de-identifying medical imaging data
tools.detailed_description: A tool developed by the Institute for Artificial Intelligence in Medicine (IKIM) for ensuring patient privacy in medical imaging datasets. It handles the removal of protected health information (PHI) from image headers and pixel data.

tools.name: Tesseract-MI
tools.one_line_profile: Browser-based platform for deploying AI in medical imaging
tools.detailed_description: An open-source platform designed to facilitate the deployment and usage of artificial intelligence models in medical imaging directly through a web browser interface, simplifying access for clinicians and researchers.

tools.name: DICOM-RST
tools.one_line_profile: DICOMweb-compatible gateway server with S3 backend
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance DICOM gateway server implemented in Rust. It provides DICOMweb and DIMSE interfaces and supports storage backends like AWS S3, facilitating scalable medical image data management for research.

tools.name: DAX
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed Automation for XNAT
tools.detailed_description: A python package for managing and automating data processing workflows on XNAT (eXtensible Neuroimaging Archive Toolkit). It enables distributed processing of large-scale imaging datasets.

tools.name: Generative MONAI
tools.one_line_profile: Generative AI extension for the MONAI framework
tools.detailed_description: A library extending MONAI with generative models (GANs, Diffusion Models) specifically tailored for medical imaging tasks such as image synthesis, anomaly detection, and translation.

tools.name: DICAT
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM header anonymization tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to anonymize DICOM data headers, ensuring the removal of sensitive patient information for research compliance.

tools.name: Anonymizer
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for anonymizing DICOM files in folders or zip archives
tools.detailed_description: A C++ based tool designed to anonymize DICOM files, supporting batch processing of folders and zip files, with error detection capabilities for medical imaging compliance.

tools.name: dicognito
tools.one_line_profile: Library and command line tool for anonymizing DICOM files
tools.detailed_description: A Python library and CLI tool for anonymizing DICOM files, allowing for the de-identification of medical imaging data for research and sharing purposes.

tools.name: xnatfs
tools.one_line_profile: Remote XNAT file system using FUSE
tools.detailed_description: A tool that mounts a remote XNAT medical imaging research platform as a local file system using FUSE, facilitating direct access and processing of stored imaging data.

tools.name: pyqaserver
tools.one_line_profile: Web interface for medical physics quality assurance using Pylinac and Orthanc
tools.detailed_description: A web-based platform integrating Pylinac and Orthanc to streamline quality assurance (QA) workflows in medical physics and radiation therapy.

tools.name: xnat-tools
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for accessing and processing data from XNAT
tools.detailed_description: A collection of utilities for interacting with XNAT servers, enabling data retrieval, processing, and management for neuroimaging and medical imaging research.

tools.name: dicom-anon
tools.one_line_profile: Python-based DICOM Anonymizer
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for anonymizing DICOM files, designed to remove Protected Health Information (PHI) from medical images for research compliance.

tools.name: dicom-pipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Automated pipeline for reviewing, anonymizing and publishing research DICOM studies
tools.detailed_description: An automated workflow tool for the ingestion, review, anonymization, and publication of DICOM studies in a research environment.

tools.name: bluelight
tools.one_line_profile: Browser-based DICOM viewer
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight, browser-based DICOM viewer for visualizing medical images directly in web environments, supporting various DICOM modalities.

tools.name: image-deid-etl
tools.one_line_profile: ETL tool for DICOM to anonymized NIfTI conversion and Flywheel upload
tools.detailed_description: A workflow tool designed to extract DICOM images from Orthanc, convert them to anonymized NIfTI format, and load them into the Flywheel research platform.

tools.name: dicomweb-server
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight DICOMweb Server with CouchDB backend
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight implementation of a DICOMweb server using CouchDB, facilitating the storage and retrieval of medical imaging data via standard web protocols for research applications.

tools.name: DIANA
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM Analytics and Archive framework
tools.detailed_description: A framework for medical image analysis and archiving, providing tools for interacting with PACS, anonymization, and integrating with research analytics pipelines.

tools.name: diana2
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM Image Analysis and Archive (Successor to DIANA)
tools.detailed_description: The second generation of the DIANA framework, offering enhanced capabilities for DICOM image analysis, archiving, and research workflow automation.

tools.name: ZeroFootPrintImageViewer_XnatView
tools.one_line_profile: Zero Foot Print Image Viewer for XNAT
tools.detailed_description: A web-based image viewer designed to integrate with XNAT, providing PACS-like visualization functionality directly within the XNAT research platform.

tools.name: openTriage
tools.one_line_profile: Platform for deploying machine learning models in clinical decision support systems
tools.detailed_description: A platform designed to facilitate the deployment and integration of machine learning models into clinical workflows for decision support.

tools.name: mcdcm
tools.one_line_profile: Javascript DICOM viewer for Orthanc
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript-based DICOM viewer specifically designed to interface with the Orthanc DICOM server for web-based medical image visualization.

tools.name: menba
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to browse and export Orthanc PACS data
tools.detailed_description: A utility to browse, manage, and export medical imaging data stored in an Orthanc PACS server, facilitating data retrieval for research.

tools.name: orthanc-client
tools.one_line_profile: Node.js client for Orthanc DICOM server
tools.detailed_description: A Node.js client library for interacting with the Orthanc REST API, enabling the development of web-based applications and services that consume medical imaging data.

tools.name: pyorthanc
tools.one_line_profile: Python library wrapping the Orthanc REST API
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that wraps the Orthanc REST API, facilitating the manipulation, retrieval, and management of DICOM data in Orthanc servers for research pipelines.

tools.name: DICOMcloud
tools.one_line_profile: Open source DICOMweb server implementation
tools.detailed_description: A C# implementation of a DICOMweb server supporting RESTful services defined in DICOM Part 18, enabling cloud-based storage and retrieval of medical images.

tools.name: PriMIA
tools.one_line_profile: Privacy-preserving Medical Image Analysis framework
tools.detailed_description: A software framework for privacy-preserving medical image analysis, utilizing federated learning and encrypted computation techniques to enable secure multi-institutional research.

tools.name: yaxil
tools.one_line_profile: Yet Another XNAT Interface Library
tools.detailed_description: A Python interface library for XNAT, designed to simplify the scripting of data retrieval, upload, and management tasks in neuroimaging research.

tools.name: SlicerBatchAnonymize
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Slicer extension for batch DICOM anonymization
tools.detailed_description: An extension for the 3D Slicer platform that enables the batch anonymization of DICOM images, integrating directly into the Slicer workflow.

tools.name: DICOMClient
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM utilities for anonymizing, viewing and uploading
tools.detailed_description: A Java-based utility tool providing command-line and GUI interfaces for anonymizing DICOM files, viewing them, and uploading them to PACS servers, supporting compliance workflows.

tools.name: Orthanc
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight DICOM server for medical imaging
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight, RESTful DICOM server designed to improve the flows of medical imaging in hospitals and research. It supports DICOM network protocols and offers a web interface and API for integration.

tools.name: Kaapana
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for medical data analysis platform provisioning
tools.detailed_description: An open-source toolkit for provisioning state-of-the-art platforms for medical data analysis, comprising AI-based workflows and federated learning scenarios, specifically for radiological imaging.

tools.name: dicomweb-pacs
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight DICOMWeb enabled PACS server
tools.detailed_description: An easy-to-use DICOMWeb enabled PACS server that includes DIMSE services and is based on a SQLite database, suitable for lightweight deployment and research data management.

tools.name: InnerEye-DeepLearning
tools.one_line_profile: Medical imaging deep learning library for 3D segmentation
tools.detailed_description: A medical imaging deep learning library designed to train and deploy 3D segmentation models on Azure Machine Learning, facilitating the integration of AI into clinical workflows.

tools.name: InnerEye-Gateway
tools.one_line_profile: DICOM inference gateway service
tools.detailed_description: A Windows service that acts as a DICOM endpoint to run inference on models trained with InnerEye-DeepLearning, bridging the gap between PACS and AI models.

tools.name: DICOM Server
tools.one_line_profile: Open source DICOMWeb standard implementation
tools.detailed_description: An open-source implementation of the DICOMWeb standard by Microsoft, designed to enable medical imaging data exchange and management in cloud environments.

tools.name: Weasis
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based DICOM viewer
tools.detailed_description: A multipurpose web-based DICOM viewer for clinical and research environments, offering advanced visualization tools and seamless integration with PACS.

tools.name: deid
tools.one_line_profile: Best effort anonymization library for medical DICOM images
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed for de-identifying (anonymizing) DICOM medical images, allowing for the removal or replacement of Protected Health Information (PHI) to ensure compliance and privacy in research datasets.

tools.name: dicom-cleaner
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for detecting and removing burned-in pixel annotations in DICOMs
tools.detailed_description: A tool under development by the pydicom organization that uses OCR and image processing to detect and clean burned-in text (pixel data) from DICOM images, addressing a critical aspect of medical image anonymization.

tools.name: pyxnat
tools.one_line_profile: Python interface for the XNAT imaging informatics platform
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that provides an interface to communicate with XNAT (eXtensible Neuroimaging Archive Toolkit), facilitating the management, retrieval, and processing of neuroimaging and medical research data.

tools.name: orthanc-s3-storage
tools.one_line_profile: AWS S3 storage plugin for Orthanc DICOM server
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for the Orthanc DICOM server that enables the storage of DICOM data in Amazon Simple Storage Service (AWS S3), facilitating scalable cloud-based deployment and data management for medical imaging.

tools.name: neurdicom
tools.one_line_profile: RESTful PACS server with plugin support
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based RESTful PACS (Picture Archiving and Communication System) server designed for medical imaging management, supporting DICOMWeb standards and plugin extensibility for research and clinical workflows.

tools.name: Orthanc-Tools-JS
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based GUI and high-level DICOM tools for Orthanc
tools.detailed_description: A web-based interface and toolset built on top of Orthanc APIs, providing a Graphical User Interface (GUI) for managing, viewing, and processing DICOM data within the Orthanc ecosystem.

tools.name: Orthanc_Tools
tools.one_line_profile: Java-based DICOM tools using Orthanc API
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Java tools and libraries designed to interact with the Orthanc DICOM server API, facilitating the development of custom medical imaging workflows and data management applications.
